<!-- ABOUT THE PROJECT -->
## About The Project

<!-- [![Product Name Screen Shot][product-screenshot]](https://example.com) -->

My university has a lot of information available on their site, but no bot to assist with information gathering. This project is about how i can efficiently collect data and train a chat bot to answer queries about the public information available on the university processes and policies.

I have little experience with chatbots and so this project will have a higher lead time for research and design.

### Inital assumptions
- the bot will need some type of knowledge base comprised of different catalogs for  undergraduate students and post graduate students. 
  - although there are many other types of stakeholders i would like to simplify this project
- The bot will need to be able to partition these users to get the correct info
- The bot hopefully can be developed in python, however it may be required to be developed in another language (god, help me)
- the AI part of this project would be two parts
  - first, the ability to take in a question from a user and identify relevent information for that question
  - second, the ability to take the question and relevant info and answer the question- initally i think this would be a LLM
- I ideally would like this to be dynamic, so a piece of code that runs through the macquaire university site and updates the knowledge base - **this is a nice to have**
- I would like this to be packaged as a back end so a front end would just need to send a request to interact with the bot.

### Chatbot Frameworks

From this [site](https://www.airdroid.com/ai-insights/open-source-chatbot/) i have selected a few different frameworks that i think could do the job:
- [Dialogflow](https://cloud.google.com/dialogflow/docs/)
  - üí∞ Offers a trial period. Then, you have to pay: Text- $0.007/request and Audio input/output- $0.06 per minute.
  - ‚úî Offers efficient text-based and voice-based AI assistants.
  - ‚úî Provides SDKs for many popular platforms + supports 20 languages.
  - ‚úî Supports Internet of Things (IoT) integration
  - ‚ùå This chatbot doesn't offer any live customer support service.
- [Rasa](https://rasa.com/)
  - üí∞ Free & Premium Version
  - ‚úî Make personalized chatbots.
  - ‚úî Multiple pipelines for production, development, and staging.
  - ‚úî Provides analytic data to boost efficiency.
  - ‚ùå The chatbots consume a lot of resources.
  - ‚ùå It requires a deep understanding of Python language and NLP
- [Micrsoft Bot Framework](https://dev.botframework.com/)
  - üí∞ Free for Standard channels. Premium plan: $0.5/1000 messages after 10,000 messages per month.
  - ‚úî Easily integrates with tools like Cortana, Microsoft Cognitive Services, and more
  - ‚úî Active learning support
  - ‚úî  The developers can design the conversation flow for their chatbots.
  - ‚ùå Steep learning curve
- [Botpress](https://botpress.com)
  - üí∞ Free & Premium Version
  - ‚úî Users can give advanced permissions.
  - ‚úî Provides clear and accurate analytics to take necessary actions.
  - ‚úî Users can build bots and deploy them on their servers.
  - ‚ùå Fewer features apart from action-based bots and analytics
- [wit.ai](https://wit.ai/)
  - üí∞ FREE
  - ‚úî Supports a staggering 132 languages.
  - ‚úî Easily integrate with Messenger.
  - ‚úî Powerful NLP engine
  - ‚úî Its SDK is available in multiple coding languages.
  - ‚ùå Requires complicated and tedious training and implementation.   

<br>

**Other Considerations for frameworks**
<br>
This bot would need to have the ability to be heavily customised as i go deeper into this topic, i am going to look for alternatives to simple FAQs and look at a better way to classify information. So the components of the bot need to be easily modified

#### Chosen framework

For this project i have decided to go with bot framework composer from Microsoft, this is becuase of the large amount of documentation online, employability of the skill, and after some research i don't think the component im most concerned with is the conversation flow. Below you can see a proposed converstion flow that i would like to achieve so most work will be developing the QnA API in python.

## Conversation Workflow

As you can see most of the development work would be done in the FAST API section.

Right now the models are undefined as this would require research into optimal approaches.

![conversation_flow](<.\docs\flow.drawio.svg>)
